author: damian
message: Nice work! 1 detail about gwenview, I think the word Deselect, with the minus sign could be confused with Delete, it might be just me, but initially I read Delete, so I thinked it was 1 button for trash and 1 button for total delete, maybe "Un-select", but again, it might be just me.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I think the icon is the right one: it is used in Dolphin and in Gwenview when you move your mouse over a selected item: clicking it "deselects" the item. What I am not sure about is the word "deselect". It is not a real English word, advices from native English speakers are welcome...

replies.author: damian
replies.message: You're right about the icon now I think about it, the part that makes me think bad is the "De" looks too much like delete, I've searched and unselect isn't even a real word, Maybe removing the word completely, as is consistent with dolphin/gwenview file list

author: Guest
message: The Gwenview work looks nice, but I have one question: what is the "Synchronize" button for? Is that related to this feature, or something else entirely that's snuck into Master when I wasn't looking?

author: Aurélien
message:
It is related to compare mode: when you check "Synchronize", compared images are synchronized: if you scroll one image it will scroll the other accordingly. This can be used for example to compare the sharpness of two pictures: zoom in, check synchronize and scroll the images over the details to inspect.

Maybe it needs a better term than "Synchronize"?

author: Stefan
message: I never understood why QLayouts have a non-zero margin by default. The only situation where a margin is useful IMO is when you put the widgets inside a frame, which is painted by the parent widget. But this is nearly never the case when one uses layouts.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I agree. Interestingly, QLayout margin was 0 by default in the Qt3 days...
